abstract: Amnesty International reports satellite imagery appears to support accounts of graves holding at least 50 victims of December political violence in Burundi capital of Bujumbura; report adds to growing evidence that atrocities committed in country were organized and covered up by country's security forces.
lead_paragraph: The Amnesty International analysis added to growing evidence of atrocities. Separately, two foreign journalists who had been detained were released.

headline.main: Burundi Mass Grave Clues Seen in Satellite Photos, Group Says
headline.print_headline: Satellite Images Appear to Corroborate Reports of Mass Killings in Burundi Unrest

snippet: The Amnesty International analysis added to growing evidence of atrocities. Separately, two foreign journalists who had been detained were released.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
